intro: Marrubium leonuroides, commonly known as the Spanish horehound, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It has a creeping growth habit with erect flowering stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Marrubium leonuroides is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its expectorant and anti-inflammatory effects.
